metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9824 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
tcp_emu in slirp/tcp_subr.c (aka slirp/src/tcp_subr.c) in QEMU 3.0.0 usesuninitialized data in an snprintf call, leading to Information disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.13').
